user_review: I have grabbed takeout service a few times during the COVID-19 shut down, so this shorter-than-average review is based on those experiences. First, I want to thank the owners and staff of Le Cartet for remaining open for the community during some tough times, I really appreciate your being there for us! Second, the sandwiches are super fresh and delicious.  Today I had a simple ham and cheese on baguette. I say simple because of the ingredient list, but wow what a great sandwich! The ham was thick and irregularly cut and had a nice sweet and clovey taste, yum. The bread was of course fantastic and had a thick smear of Dijon butter with some fresh lettuce and tasty cheese. Simple, but oh so good!  I am looking forward to trying the sit-down brunch service when things settle down!
the food is really good here, coffee could be better but their recipes are amazing. they have  some amazing sausages for brekkie! yum

Use to love coming here, but the last few times I noticed that portions are decreasing in size, and items are often being missed from dishes.The quality also seems tohave gone downhill over the last 5 years or so.Given the prices, I would expect more.Hope they can get back to were they once were. Until then, will be going elsewhere.

Le Cartet has been on my list for quite some time, but to be frank, I must say it sadly didn't live up to the expectations! The served brunch dishes were lacking flavour and portions were small for the price. Their signature ice coffee was blend and way too much ice! However, service was quick and friendly, staff wore masks all time. 3.5 rounding it up to 4, to take into account current situation.

They are really good with breakfast and brunch. We ordered a few items and they where all amazing. I have no complaints about anything I had on their menu. I had the all beef and beans dish and it was so flavorful. I loved it !!! Definitely a great breakfast spot. I have no issues with this place, it was worth it.Overall score: 7.8 out of 10Food: 8 out of 10Service 7.5 out of 10 Vibes: 8 out of 10

Boo Boo and I had a nice long brunch here when we were in Montreal. We ordered the brunch plates Cantons and Nordique. I specifically  remembered I snagged the last maple croissant.  The food was tasty and substantial because we walked to the botanitcal garden afterwards.We waited for 10-15 minutes. But, its worth it.bathroom clean. CC accepted.Our waiter was very nice. I felt bad for him since he had the outside area.

Have to say I'm a little disappointed. Had heard so much hype about this place, but the flavours were just not there. Tried the toscan poached eggs (sauce bland , potatoes cold )and the lac brome eggs Benedict (sauce was great, duck was yummy, eggs were over cooked )Décor is cute, service is great. But for the price, Montreal has many other places that will WOW you more .

A must try if you are in Montreal! A cute charming little restaurant with some fantastic dishes. We had the Nordique and the Jalapeno. With the signature dishes you can add on a mimosa, and its come to about $28.00 - well worth it!I highly recommend the Jalapeno, a great mexican breakfast. The scrambled eggs were some of the best we have ever tried. The service was very friendly, quick and attentive.

This spot was so good my boyfriend and I came here twice while visiting Montreal. The first time I got the Toscan which was superb. The second time I ordered Lac Brome which is Le Cartet's spin on egg Benedict. I order a vanilla latte too and it was exceptional. Five stars for Le Cartet all the way!

I love this little spot: I have loved it for years and the quality has never wavered. I visited recently while in Montreal for a Birthday weekend, and made this stop for a special Birthday brunch - it didn't disappoint. I had an amazing meal with poached eggs and avocado, topped off with the best yogurt I have ever had in my life, fresh orange juice, and of course, coffee. I can not describe how good this food is - just go. It's a little on the pricey side, but totally worth it as a social treat. SO. GOOD!

Between all the searching and places coming up CLOSED for the day- and set to reopen between 5-5:30pm, Cartet was the lone survivor. I honestly didn't want anything too filling and liked Cartet's Brunch menu right away with Salads, Waffles, Croissants and such.As we were told, Cartet has changed with the times- and for the better. Place is very comfortable and cute. See it as a long space with steps leading up inside, seating along the whitewashed brick wall and middle aisle- and kitchen/prep stations to the right. Let me not forget their gourmet shop as you enter if you want to stock up on their dry Pastas, Oils, Jams, Teas (Kusmi) and Chocolates....the list goes on and on.Cartet brings in a really nice eye to simple style. This ultra trendy- yet friendly, low-key spot is almost like a full-service type shop. Both of our Brunch items and Aperol Spritz were good. Service was pleasant and price was on point. Cartet earns its place here for a cool atmosphere without it being stuffy at all. And if you want to mix with the locals- this is the place to come.

Brunchers would love this place.  Modern, but casual and definitely inviting.  There was a small section inside the restaurant where specialty products were sold.  We were seated almost immediately and while waiting,  I've seen locals walked in, to grab ready made meals from their open fridge as "takeout".   It took a while for our food to arrive that I had time to peruse their little store, twice.  Good looking maple syrups,  sardines, bottled tuna, canned foie gras, chocolates and shortbread cookies (La Mere Poulard!- my new addiction), were all on display. I bought stuff as souvenirs here, for myself, lol.Then my 'Jalapeño'  came. Star of our meal, I should say: festive and flavorful! The chorizo,  the red bell pepper, avocado and cheese got along so well with the scrambled egg.  It also came with salad and sour cream(?) sauce with the perfect blend of smoky sauce. This is what to get here, I think. If only I could drink,  tsk, their mimosas were so inviting.

Came here for their breakfast. Saw good reviews about them and thought of checking it out. The waiter when taking my order was rushing. I understand that their menu was changing to the lunch one and I felt she should have not done that.So I ordered the eggs scrambled with goat cheese. After eating half of the meal I found a hair to be on my food. I told the waitress and she said they will make a new one. The mistake was in their side and I would have appreciated if they gave like 50% off or some other dish as a complimentary. Nothing was provided and I felt disappointed on them.The food was good. I came here for their eggs and it was really good. The side of salad was one of the tastiest salads I ever tried. Maybe they need to focus on quality control and if a mistake occurs to properly handle it.
We split the jalapeño with a side of the smoked salmon and it was one of the best breakfasts we've had in Montreal. The flavors were on point.

Meh. That's all I have to say about this spot. Came here on Saturday, it was a full house, and thus there was a bit of a wait to get seated. Once we were seated and ordered, the food took about 30-40 mins to come out, possibly longer. The food tasted good but was nothing out of the ordinary. May be a good spot during the week but I'd avoid on weekends.

Excellent brunch, just a tad bit pricey. They have a lot of breakfast/brunch/lunch options, and all their brunches come with a mimosa which explains why the price is high. I don't like mimosas but they wouldn't let me swap for a bloody. I ended up ordering a separate drink.The service is good and the food is excellent, with some hefty portions. I had the brunch Cartet and it had a little bit of everything, a croissant ham sandwich, scrambled eggs, fruit, and salad. Their benedict is great as well.Gluten free folks...they have GF bread! Inside is super sleek and modern, with a take-away stand for coffee and pastries, but if it's nice, sit outside!

Delicious and the portion is very big. In the pic, the top dish has really nice salad with fresh vinegar taste. Salmon on top of black bread with blue cheese in between. The bottom dish is a must for people who is very hungry. Bacon is high quality.One of my favorite brunch places.

I loved the atmosphere , the people here are very welcoming and sweet. I had the Le Santé and white chocolate chaud. Let me just tell you.  Never in my life have I been a fan of white chocolate. I decided to give the white chocolate chaud a try and I'm honestly glad I did because it changed the hot chocolate game for me it was so delicious! I have also never had poached eggs with goat cheese and multigrain bread combination it was perfect , and you know me can't forget my yogurt and granola!

I came here for breakfast on a recommendation that this was the best brunch spot. The service is a bit slow but I'm beginning to think that's just a Canadian thing. I mean, no one moves at a New York pace after all. At first glance of the menu, I was a bit skeptical. I'm not a huge breakfast food fan as I feel like all eggs are pretty much the same. And why even bother with oatmeal or "bowls" of any sort. The scramble eggs and smoked jalapenos caught my eye as something different. I skipped the coffee and went straight for a glass of white wine. Who cares it's only 9am?Omg. These scrambled eggs were epic. They actually had flavor and were just a bit runny like they should be. Not overcooked at all. I went down for a bite and never came back up for air. Amazing.

If you're walking around Old Montreal, this is an adorable breakfast stop! Our eggs and coffee were delicious, as well as the brioche french toast (highly recommend solely for the apple jam on top). Definitely one of the best breakfast options in the area!

One of the best meals I had in Montreal. We came a prime brunch time and did not have to wait long but were treated to complimentary banana bread and orange juice to start and I ordered the brunch sante. It came with delicious granola and yogurt, fresh fruit, poached eggs ontop of toast and a few slices of cheese and figs. I loved the fact that there were so many things to eat just on one plate! My tastebuds never got bored and I truly enjoyed every component of this meal. My brother got the brunch de l'atlantique with salmon and cream cheese on a bagel and another assortment of tasty foods. He added some sausage for some extra protein. My mom got the brunch cartet which was similar to the l'atlantique but with a eggs and ham croissant instead.Overall, I LOVED the amount of variety in each plate of food here. It was all fresh and absolutely delicious. The atmosphere was also light and overall a feel good place.

Loved loved loved this brunch place! Its very big so there was no long lineup even on a Saturday morning. Took coffee & mimosa to start. I had better coffee... Then avocado toast with an extra side of potatoes. This is a great choice for vegetarians or vegans or simply for people who love avocado toast! My eating partner took a great egg (benedict) plate. Was happy with his eggs but mentioned that some potatoes were undercooked. Service is fast. Very satisfied with this place. Enjoy!

Nice spot for breakfast. Little on the pricey side, but the portions are HUGE and everything is super fresh. Added the smoked salmon to my meal. So worth it. The portion was huge and very fresh.Anglophones are good here, but practice some basic ordering phrases to get by a bit easier.

Higher-end fancy breakfast place! Everything was really good. They have a ready-to-go food section at the front if you're not looking to have a sit down breakfast.The place was chic with modern/rustic decor. There were plenty of seating areas when we came by for a brunch. The service was great and food came out fairly quickly.We got a hot chocolate and a vanilla latte to start. I've never tasted better hot chocolate, it was super rich with a slight bitter taste, but the brown sugar added the perfect sweetness to balance the dark chocolate. The vanilla latte had the perfect sweetness without even adding the extra brown sugar that was included. We got a beef tartare to share, it had the right amount of seasoning with toasted bread. I got the Duck Confit Sandwich that came with a side salad. It was perfectly toasted with cheese and hints of sweetness. I tried the Maple Chicken Avocado toast and that was also delicious! Highly recommend! It can be a little pricey though, but I think its worth it. I would love to come back to this place to try other things on the menu when I do come back to visit Mtl.

Came to this place twice. The first time I took the salmon cake and the portion was very small. This time I had the scrambled eggs with jalapeno peppers. It was good. I thought it would be spicy (jalapeno...) but it wasn't. The portion was ok and it was good. If you come on a weekend, the place is packed and theres a lineup at the door. The first time I was here I had to share a banquet with other people and since it was winter, it was very unconfortable. There just wasn't enough space and we couldn't put our winter coats anywhere. This time we went on a thursday. The place was empty and I had a much better experience. As for the service, our waitress was nice and friendly both times.

A cafe with a shop up front, this place serves up some serious brunch food. There are a lot of brunch plates that come in cast iron skillets, as well as bagel breakfasts (get the famous Montréal bagel!) and other small items. I got the brunch with ham, sausage and bacon, complete with scrambled eggs, duck fat potatoes and baked beans on the side. It was scrumptious and delicious! The bacon wasn't the thinly sliced kind, but a hunk of pork belly, which had a hint of sweetness and was very tender. The portion was quite large and I couldn't finish it - plus by the end I really wanted some veggies to go with it. Sort of my fault for ordering the meatiest item on the menu, really. The service was ok (bit slow but similar to other places in town), and the shop in front was lovely and sold a lot of local foodstuff - perfect for a tourist to take back home!

First time exploring Montreal and this place was highly recommended by the hotel staff and the local starbucks baristas, so i just had to visit ! I'm not exaggerating when I say it's the best eggs Benedict I've ever had. I ordered LE TOSCA:  Eggs Benedict  with a side arugula salad, sausage & roasted baby potato's topped with the light and creamy hollandaise sauce :) the staff was super friendly and welcoming as well they speak both English & French . Lastly they also have a cute grab and go market section by the main entrance with all types of loca preñada sándwiches / dry snacks and beverages !

Ive been coming to Montreal every year for the past 4 years, and i never get tired of it. The air is fresh and crisp, the people are friendly, transport ion is so efficient and the food is AMAZING..We typically wing it when it comes to meals in Montreal. We always plan last minute so we can never get the places we want to go without booking months in advance, but this only applies to dinner, as for lunch, we try to eat local (around the downtown area, where we usually stay) or whatever we are in the mood of. Not too fancy or expensive, cause we rather splurge on dinner.It was Friday morning, we didnt have a heavy dinner the night before so we wanted a slightly denser lunch, rather than a bagel or a croissant. But it turns out not many places are open for brunch/lunch on weekdays in Montreal apparently. It was not easy to find a brunch place. I used Yelp and came upon Le Cartet. It had really good rating and the Le Canton pics was what drew me there. We took the bus, which wasnt too far from downtown, it basically took us a block away from the restaurant. We arrived around a little before noon. There was no wait, but there were a lot of seat taken. I ordered a maple latte and boy was it delicious. No wonder Canada is known for their maple syrup, it was soooo good but to some, it will be very sweet. Even for me, it was a tad sweet. It was good but very hard to drink half way. Maybe on ice it would have been better but since it was cold, i opted for the hot version.As my entree, i got the Le Canton, i think it was the beans that caught my eye. It was a cold morning so i needed something comforting. nothing says comforting than some beans right?The plate came out sizzling and with lots of food. There was really no room for anything. i was not expecting the bacon to be like thick/large chunks of pork belly. it was so good, very juicy and tender. the sausage had that skin where is snapped when you slick into it. The eggs were light and fluffy, potatoes were roasted with lots of herbs.  And finally the beans, it was the best beans ive ever had. It was sweet and smoky and cooked to perfection. It was not too mushy or hard, it was just right. I was so full i couldnt even eat the toast that came with it and i even had to share the platter with my bf.This was definitely the best meal i had during my visit to Montreal this time around. this meal beat out Europea and even Joe Beef. I am definitely going back to Le Cartet, I dont know if i will try another dish since this dish was soooo good.

I come here quite often for brunch out of convenience, but the food isn't extraordinary or anything. The service is always efficient and friendly, and sometimes there's a line and other times there isn't. I don't particularly feel that this is a high-end brunch place. The seating feels quite impersonal for some reason, because people are always coming in and out for the café section of the restaurant.The food here isn't innovative, but they serve the classic brunch food. Summers here are charming, because they have seating on the sidewalk terrasse. Don't know what's the rave, just ordinary breakie! I would give it a 3.5.

We got the salmon toast, crepes, and meat dish with sausage, bacon and ham. The sausage was my favorite. The crepe was thin and well made, it came with a side of yogurt and fruits. We absolutely loved all the dishes we ordered and ate every bite. The flavors were perfectly paired. They even had WIFI :)

If you are looking for a fresh, healthy and comforting breakfast, this place is it. It was so hard to choose as everything looked amazing. The service was great, everyone is so accommodating there. Every morning we were in town we all wished we could have that breakfast all over again! This is a must to visit if you are in the area!

Eat here.I am tempted to write no review other than you must eat here.  We ate here as a break from Old Port and were delighted with our short walk away from Old Port.  We went during the week after the lunch rush.  We were seated immediately.  Our family - hubby, 10 and 7 year old old, and me - each ordered different items.  I ordered quiche. Jeff ordered crepes.  Daughter ordered full breakfast.  Son ordered yogurt with fruit and granola.  Grown ups also had cappuccinos.  Everything was delightful.  Kids ate everything on their plates.  We had delightful service.  Like I mentioned, my review could simply be eat here.
Great ambiance and energy. The Nordic was very good... not too heavy. Waitstaff were friendly and efficient.

Food: For 2, we got Le Santé and Le Nordique for breakfast. It was fresh, light, and tasty. The yogurt was thick and creamy, and the house granola was free of peanuts and sesame and was so satisfying. Eggs were poached perfectly, with the yolk still runny. You can also buy the granola for home, as well as other prepared meals, coffee, and pastries. Service: Friendly but a bit slow (hence the 4 star) - we waited about 20 min for water and to place our order, and it felt extra long because we were so hungry!Tip: Breakfast is only served until 11:15am so get there on time! After 11:15 they'll wait 30-45 min and then start lunch. We had to come back a second day once we learned our lesson!

My favourite workday lunch!  I've been here maybe a dozen times and have enjoyed every meal I've ordered so far from breakfast to lunch.   Not a big pasta fan but when I had one of their pasta dishes, I was impressed with how much I enjoyed their al dente pasta!   Pick anyone! Their soups are also good and salads are light and fresh.The staff have always been very courteous and pleasant, which is a big thing.  I tend to get analysis paralysis when I have to decide on the spot where to eat...especially in a food court setting! Happily, I can safely say that Le Cartet is my no-brainer go-to resto and I'm guaranteed a nice food experience :dThe reason I can't give them 5 stars is that a few times I've eaten there, there was always at least 1 pesky small black fly, moth or something buzzing around!! It's small so not too crazy but definitely annoying to have to swat it away.  Other than that, I love the ambiance inside. It's bright and well lit, not overly noisy to allow lunch conversation.

Came here on a wintry Saturday afternoon and was able to be seated immediately upon arrival. I ordered the matcha latte and scrambled eggs with asparagus cheddar cheese. It was delicious. The matcha latte tasted wonderful, with none of that artificial processed matcha flavoring. It was also just the right level of sweet: a little bit to counteract the bitterness of the matcha powder, but not overwhelming. There was even some foam at the top! As for the eggs, they were rich but not too heavy. The asparagus and cheddar cheese combination was a great blend on my palette, and the refreshing green salad balanced the meal quite well. The bread was delicious and had a wonderful texture.Tables also received a free sample of caramel bread pudding upon being seated. Great experience and would love to come back!
Really good brunch menu. Highly recommend the Le Canton. Calm ambience, peaceful. If you like clean, quiet brunch areas I recommend this place.

While in Olde Montreal, we decided to roam around for a few souvenirs and realized we were hungry. Looked on Yelp, and I had this place bookmarked. Yes, of course, we sat on their front patio.Polite, timely service from our waiter. During the lunch hours, you can get a half of any of their sandwiches and a bowl of soup for $15 Canadian. I ordered their grilled chicken, corn, roasted red pepper sammie (forget the name) and their gazpacho soup. My mother got the roasted veggie and fresh Camembert cheese sandwich, also with their gazpacho. BOTH meals were really good! And very filling!! Sandwiches were hot and fresh right out of the kitchen. The cold Gazpacho was creamy and full of flavor. The quality olive oil drizzle on top was a delight. Lots of chicken in mine. Light on the sauce, so nothing was drowned out. The huge strips of roasted veggies on my mother's sammie were sooo flavorful. I feel like Camembert is not used enough, and I was super glad to get a bite :))

Absolutely loved the brunch here. So many healthy and vegetarian-friendly options, cute surroundings, and great service. The oatmeal and the house-made bread were excellent. There is also a cute little shop selling sandwiches and other prepared foods as well as gourmet condiments to go.
Came here from the yelp reviews and I'm so glad we did!  Possibly one of the best breakfasts I've had!  The flavors were amazing!  No complaints.

Close location to our hotel in Old Montreal, came here for lunch. The place was packed but were seated immediately. Service was attentive and not too slow considering how busy they were. I had the parsnip soup and poke bowl - both specials that day. My husband had Le Canton - a cast iron skillet of yummy goodness with ham, sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs and beans. So very good. Prepared meals that were available for take out and cute market at front of restaurant. Would definitely go back.

I randomly decided to check out Le Cartet last Saturday morning. It's a pretty bustling place. Lots of people and lots of conversation but it's definitely a spot where I could sip something nice and vibe out to a good book.I ordered a small cappuccino (because I'm obsessed) and loves every ounce of it. Shortly thereafter, my scrambled eggs with goat cheese showed up. To my surprise, the portion was huge. There was fresh fruit on my plate. And, the smoked salmon that I ordered on the side was perfect (yes capers!). Everything that came out of the kitchen looked great and everyone in the establishment looked to genuinely be pleased. The staff was also super friendly (that always helps!).Honestly, I was pleasantly surprised by Le Cartet. I will definitely have it firmly on the itinerary the next time I'm in Montreal.

There is one thing you have to learn about Montreal. No parking and lots of traffic. This place was painful to get to because of the construction and a lot of one ways. The place was very cute and smelled so good. This is just a matter of preference. I got the scrambled eggs with chorizo and avocado. It had great flavor, my only issue is I don't like my eggs on the soft side. I prefer it more cooked. I asked for 1 French toast and instead I got toasted French bread. I didn't know I had to specify the sweet version. But overall good spot for food and the parfaits are delicious.
Delicious breakfast! We came in pretty early morning on a weekday and there was no wait, sat outside with the dog. Great service, polite and friendly and such a great

OMG! This place was fabulous. There is outdoor seating they were out of what I wanted. I ordered the avocado toast, and they had no vegetables. But they did make it for me with salad and extra avocado and more tomatoes. I would highly recommend this place for breakfast if you are in old Montreal.   The inside is very nice there is a little area to buy some stuff, and you can get food to go. If you're into coffee order the coffee with the alcohol in it, it has maple syrup and whiskey. Enjoy!!

This is my favourite brunch place. I think possibly ever.... Yep, ever.There is always a line (it moves quickly). The food is delicious and arrives fast at the table. Coffee is also on point and the option to add a mimosa to your brunch plate is perfect.My fave plates are the brunch sante or whatever the one is with salmon - YAS!Love the selection of ready made foods and gourmet gifts (coffees, chocolates, olives, etc).If I am visiting Montreal, this is one of my must stop places to visit.

I went there for brunch on the weekend. I must say that it is ordinary and expensive for what they serve. It is located in the old port, so it is understandable that it is a bit more expensive. There are much better places to go for brunch in Montreal and for less money.

They serve the most AMAZING Maple Syrup Latte...sooo good. Wish I can could import it. nom nom nom. I don't even drink coffee.I came for brunch which is served till 11:15am,  not 11:00am, not 11:30am. Seating was easy because I showed up late morning on a nice frigid morning. I was visiting from out of town and it was off season in terms of crowds. There seem to be regular adult having late breakfast, so it was not packed with hipsters or mommies and kids.TO eat I got the Le Canton. It was a lot for me but I sat there until it was all gone. Not use to eating that much meat for breakfast.Only downside to this meal was that i felt it was salty as all heck.  So if you have high blood pressure/hypertension, do NOT get this. The meats harboured way too much sodium. Prob get your daily intake in one meal.I likely would not get that meal again. But there were other menu items that looked really good so I would like to try those in the future with more maple syrup latte.

Just came back from brunch at Le Cartet, unfortunately another high rated restaurant that fell short. I got there just before 10am, the place was bustling with hipsters. Not only is it a restaurant but also a mini market. The place is nice and modern, it also has seating outside. I met two of my colleagues there and we quickly ordered our plates along with 3 mimosas. We waited maybe 10 minutes before our food arrived which was pretty decent considering how busy it was. The plates were nice, combinations were good. The salmon croquette was excellent. The ham croissant was delicious. Mimosa were also pretty fantastic. You might be thinking why am I giving it a 1 star then. Two main reasons:First there was hair in my salad which totally grossed me out.Second the response of the waitress Annie when I told her, and I quote "I hope it wasn't curly" then she laughed. Maybe she found that funny but I certainly did not.When the bill arrived she charged me full price. That's not good business. Guess I will have to find another hip brunch place.
Such a quaint brunch spot! It has a great ambiance with modern yet warm and the food is great! My go-to brunch place in the old port!

Came for breakfast and loved it! I had le sante and their yogurt/granola/honey/blueberry combo was amazing. They must make their yogurt in house because I've never enjoyed yogurt so much in my life. The poached eggs and multigrain toast it came with was delicious too. Loved my latte, only wish I had ordered the large from the beginning. Friendly staff and we don't speak any French. Don't miss it!
This place was so yummy !!! Fresh juice and ham were delicious, what else can you ask for! Ambience was nice, I did not have to wait to be seated. People were nice! I will be back!

We were in Old Montreal for brunch and I really wanted to try Olive & Gourmando, but it had a 30-45 minute wait and we were in a rush, so we walked a few blocks to Le Cartet.  There was a wait here too, but since we got here relatively early (10am), we only had to wait 5 minutes or so.  I love the space, it reminds me of Le Pain Quotidien in NYC.  There is a huge communal table in the middle and a few two/four-tops on the side.  The dishes were not cheap for brunch in Montreal (CAD 19), but they include a coffee, juice and an amuse bouche, as well as a large plate of food, so not a bad deal.I had the Brunch Cartet, which included a croissant sandwich with ham and cheese, salmon cake, side salad, a few slices of cheddar cheese and fresh fruits.  I love croissants, but I don't indulge in it often.  This was a delicious sandwich with a good ham-cheese-to-croissant ratio.  Also, the croissant itself was well-made.  I wasn't crazy about the salmon cake.  The menu description for this dish mentioned a fig, and I was quite disappointed that it was a dried fig and not a fresh one, but that's just me being nit-picking.The guy ordered Brunch De L'atlantique, which included a small bagel with smoked salmon, scrambled egg with smoked salmon, as well as salmon cake, salad and fruits.  I really liked the smoked salmon and scrambled egg combo, the bagel was pretty good too.The service was attentive without being intrusive, I've got coffee and water refills immediately.  The dining room was packed but it didn't feel tight.  It was a good brunch place.

Classic French style breakfast in the heart of Old Montreal.  Sounds like a winning combo to me.  This place has a small marketplace selling things to go on top of the sit down restaurant.The menu is fairly large and has a good mix of egg dishes coupled with pastries for one to choose from.  Le Canton was great as it came with scrambled eggs, thick cut ham, sausage, potatoes and baked beans all cooked in duck fat.  Yum. The scrambled eggs with dill and salmon were also excellent.  However, the best bite came from the croissant which everyone agreed was top notch.  Service is good here and very friendly.  Prices are very reasonable.  I would recommend this place as anyone's primary choice for breakfast in the area.

Le Cartet has turned me on to the deliciousness that is goat cheese in scrambled eggs, and I will be forever grateful.My boyfriend and I decided to brunch at Le Cartet when we visited Montreal, and I really have to credit Yelp with getting us to check out this cozy spot.When you first arrive, you walk through the small specialty foods area. Chocolate bars of all sorts line the wall just beyond the entrance, and other fun food finds (like maple syrup, coffee and olive oil) are to your left. Looking around is a fun distraction while waiting for your table to be called, which for us took about 15 minutes. We were seated along a long table, hip-to-hip with other diners, but that didn't bother us. I ordered the aforementioned scrambled eggs with goat cheese, which came on bread and also came with potatoes roasted in duck fat and fruit. I ordered a bagel with cream cheese, so I can could try the Montreal bagels I had heard so much about. And again, these eggs! Just do it! My boyfriend got the Brunch de L'Atlantique, which includes a ramekin of scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, half of a smoked salmon bagel, a salmon and sweet potato cake, salad and fruit. Now this is a pretty breakfast! I liked the cake the best. It was very similar to a crab cake. And as if all of this food wasn't enough, we enjoyed mimosas and an amuse-bouche that reminded me of coffee cake. The servers seemed experienced with getting diners through quickly -- a must considering how popular this place seems to be -- but our server was very attentive and polite at the same time. He went through the menu with us in English, and answered each question we had. Happily full after our meal, we then took more time to peruse the specialty food offerings and bought quite a few items to bring home to give to loved ones as souvenirs. Getting a great meal and some shopping done at the same time was such a nice benefit, especially considering we had only a few days to spend in this glorious city. One-stop shopping at its finest!

Located in the Old Port of Montreal, this place serves different kinds of food for either lunch or breakfast. When entering the store, you will see a various selection of pre-made meals, which is perfect for lunch. Browsing a little bit, most of the plates were hovering around 10$, which includes different salads and sandwiches. However, I was not there for that. I went there for their breakfast. On a weekday morning, the place was relatively not so crowded. I was seated right away. The decor of the restaurant itself was pleasant. Service also was very good. Now to the real talk, the food itself. I decided to go for the "Canton" breakfast, which consist of a pan with eggs, beans, potatoes, bacon and ham. That came out to be 16$ before taxes. The portion itself was fair, but would've appreciated more for the price. As for the food quality itself, I cannot say that there was anything special. The eggs were average, the ham itself was a little burnt. Overall, I do not think I would come back as it is a little expensive for what it offers. Great service otherwise!

Always enjoy going there for brunch. Expect to wait in line! but it does move.. We ordered the Brunch Sante and Brunch Sucre. Never again! I had the Brunch Sucre, it was sugar over load.... in sweetness and in volume.  I do recommend sharing this plate! the wild blueberries are fantastic and the cream is not too thick. The crepes are are very good and quite dense, you may want to take a walk in the old port after. The Brunch sente was more reasonable. The granola yogurt is think and really good. I added some maple syrup to it as well .  I still have a hard time getting use to paying for a regular coffee when almost every other brunch place it's included! it's not like the price of the plate is not allowing for a free coffee :)  However they do include orange juice (still would rather the coffee).

I believe that Daphne M.'s review says it all. This really is a must when you're in town. My visit wouldn't have been complete without it. Indeed, life itself is more complete now that I've been here.Food: I ordered the hot cast iron thing with meats and beans all around. It was scrumptious! My wife ordered the salmon with baguette because the restaurant didn't get its bagel delivery in the morning, boo! Both were delicious nonetheless. Drink the vanilla latte!Service: extremely friendly and responsive.Decor: it's tight in here, but everything is extremely clean, especially the restrooms.Try to get here early because the line can get really long! Park one block over at the public meters and walk briskly (to stay warm).

Le Cartet is my favorite cafe in Montreal! Very French. Beautiful communal wooden table in the middle with danish lamps hanging from the top.I made my first trip there on the July 4th weekend, and the famous toasted coconut bread was not available as the cafe was closed the previous day. I probably made this trip just to try the bread, although I'd never admit it. :) It was heaven.

A lovely French restaurant with an area with outside seating. It also has a specialty food store at the front of the restaurant. You can buy coffee, teas, and a vide variety of chocolates. They even have vegan chocolate options. Food was delicious as well and the yogurt & granola combo was fantastic.
The breakfast plates are beautiful and delicious. The Nordique with capers, smoked salmon and goat cheese is a must have.
Amazing, yummy brunch. My daughter is insisting we go back for the crepes with fresh fruit. The Nordic was sublime.

I was in Montreal for 24hrs with my boyfriend, and while visiting the old city, we decided to have lunch here. The street is pretty, with lots of other restaurants, but somehow we picked this one because of its window with all different products and the big common tables you can see from outside. Such a perfect choice! The atmosphere is lovely. All waitress and I am assuming the owner are ladies, dress in black, super nice. We ordered their lunch specials of sandwich and soup/salad, which came also with fresh bottle of water (free as well as their refills), and bread with butter. The soup was delicious, served inside a tiny pot. My sandwich was amazing, with tons of salmon in it. My boyfriend had a more regular baguette one, but really full of ingredients, with a side of colorful tasty original salad. We really enjoyed, and I suggest this gem to everyone who is visiting the old city! Also, free speedy wifi, and cool crowds.Thank you Le Cartet!

I saw the high rating on Yelp and decided to go here for brunch. This place was super busy and had to wait for a bit. I got the des cantons (I think that was the name), which was essentially the English  breakfast served in a cast iron skillet. The  presentation was good and the piece of ham was delicious. But, overall it's a bit expensive imo.
The coffee is on point. The food to dine in was full of France taste to the last bite. The mish mash if I can recall the right name. Close walk to the northern dame.

The food was AMAZING! I got their version of an eggs Benedict and it was delicious. We were there for brunch, so they did not have children size portions. It was a bit much for my kids, but their food was good. Other than the flies flying everywhere, the atmosphere was wonderful. Love the decor and tables!

My fiance and I made Le Cartet our first grub stop after we arrived in Montreal, starving from our long drive from New York.  The line was literally out the door, with pedestrians struggling to make their way through because hungry folks in line were blocking the wide sidewalk.  Well, despite our hunger, we figured a long line is a good sign, so we waited about 20-30 minutes to get in.We were directed by a friendly staff into the loooooong restaurant.  The long dining tables, which I would unhesitatingly put into my own dining room, were very fitting given the restaurant's length.  Me like!  So we started off with 2 cappucinos.  I ordered the bowl after being informed of the size of the cup, and my fiance ordered the cup.  Yes, I eat like a fat person and it's quite embarrassing when my male partner's portions are smaller than my own.  Anywho, the cappucinos were creamy, frothy and smooth ... a great start to our brunch!I decided to go with the Brunch de L'Atlantique and my fiance went with Brunch des Cantons.  I love salmon so this was the perfect dish for me.  It featured a potato and salmon cake, smoked salmon over bagel and eggs with salmon, sided with salad and fruits.  My fiance's didn't appeal to me too much because I was so absorbed with my salmony meal, but his dish was by far more savory, with sausages, eggs and ham.  Both dishes came with a glass of orange juice, which really filled us up.  I left nothing but crumbs on my plate and left with a happy tummy.  Definitely worth the wait!

Be sure to arrive early to avoid the line ups!So this is a popular brunch place amongst Montrealers with a shop in front of the restaurant that sells pâté, all sorts of chocolates, goodies, etc. To be completely honest, their food wasn't memorable. I got the Brunch Cartet and the rest of my party got the Brunch Toscan and Brunch de l'Atlantique. I enjoyed the first bite of my salmon cake but then it was just dry afterwards - would be nice to throw some sauce on the side. Our brunch came with orange juice which was a plus.I thought the food was "okay" and nothing more. I wouldn't return.

A pretty definitive Old-Montreal brunch spot.Le Cartet is the place that reminds me of my very first impressions of Montreal upon moving here. The loft-style trimmings in the main dining area, the vaguely French feel to the entrance and window display, the unique blend of supermarket leisure and professional bustle all combine to create a distinct atmosphere. The sit-down experience is comfy, yet retains a certain polish to it. Weekday lunches and weekend brunches are filled with the hum of smartly dressed young professionals. Daily specials range from something as delicate as gazpacho to something as... gung-ho... as pulled pork. Friendly servers buzz around, seemingly in perpetual motion. The "grab-n-go" section is not to be ignored, with some pretty tasty salads, meals and snacks, and quite a bit of exotica to peruse. Not a bad place to stop by for supplies as you explore the Old Port.
Charming breakfast / brunch place in the old port but expensive for what you are getting.Usually a wait as well which brings it down on my list of recommendations

Sunday Brunch Spectacular- had Brunch Cartet which was a plate of scrambled egg, salad, cheese, salmon cake (amazing!), and ham croissant. Show stealer: croissant. So good. Not too flaky but not not too solid either, wasn't too salty or too sweet, simply perfect. Probably the best croissant in montreal. I had the ham removed because i don't eat pork so my croissant came just with cream cheese but I'd rather have nothing on it and just go for plain croissant. I cannot stop fawning about how great the texture and softness of the croissant was. Next time I come, I'm simply getting a good ol' croissant avec cafe.Everything else was great too but honestly the croissant was so good that the rest pales down to it. I also had a latte (they use beans by illy) which was also a rich and smooth blend of milk and coffee, not too bitter. Definitely recommend. All brunch plates also come with bread pudding (not my fav) and (super-duper) fresh orange juice.Best part is the location, situated south of downtown, in the heart of a non-touristy part old port. It's like walking into a perfect life and having your dreams fulfilled in cup of coffee. Great ambience and had a great experience.P.s. hot waiters ;)

Love this place! As a group of 4 for brunch we had the sucre, Canton, Nordique and Tuscan and not a single plate disappointed. As the Nordique brunch eater my plate was the perfect serving at a reasonable cost. The ingredients are very fresh, the bread soft and delicious and overall a very satisfying meal for a smoker salmon lover. My matcha latte although in a strange and somewhat inconvenient to hold glass was thick, creamy, earthy and truly delicious as a wake up. Although the place gets a bit noisy and you often wait a bit for a table when more than 2 it's cozy and warm feeling. Also wonderful to watch the kitchen work since it's open

I'm so glad we came here for brunch on a rainy day. It was very busy but we only waited 10-15 minutes for a table.My table ordered and shared the brunch des cantons, brunch sucre and brunch cartet - each plate came with juice. This brunch was one of my top highlights from my Montreal trip. Everything from service to food to atmosphere was on point. I would highly recommend this place! I can't wait to come back here again on my next trip.

So so so so SO happy we found this place on our way back to Boston. What a cute little restaurant with French decor and friendly waiters/waitresses. We had an amazing waiter. He was accommodating even though we were a huge group of people and was extremely polite. I ordered the matcha latte. It was pretty spot on in terms of matcha-ness. I ordered the Le Sante. The eggs were perfectly poached on top of the bread with the little pesto sauce on the bottom. It came with a fig and a couple slices of cheese as well. The greek yogurt, however, is the real winner here. So creamy and the granola and blueberries on top were phenomenal. No, I'm not exaggerating. They had some really good greek yogurt! My boyfriend ordered the Des Cantons which comes in an iron skillet and has all types of meat, beans, eggs, and potatoes. He said he enjoyed it very much and was full from it. Definitely would make a stop next time we're in Montreal! Loved everything about it.

Waiting time after ordering is longer than usual. Famous spot and if you choose the table outside, you will be in many tourists' photos. Food is at average level of Montreal brunches. Lac brome tastes better than cantons. The duck breast is tasty.
2nd time here, crepes were excellent!  Always look forward to breakfast at Le Cartet when we are in Montreal.

Great menu selection for brunch at decent price, this should be one of your top restaurant choice if you are looking for egg benedict or other eggy dish, execution is excellent. Brunch menu comes with fresh orange juice.
Wonderful Brunch!!!  Great atmosphere and very nice staff.  Food was amazing.  Would recommend.

Amazing find. My wife just said it's the best breakfast she's ever had. Fantastic. Fresh squeezed juice, perfect poached eggs big meaty hand cut ham I think the sausage and bacon is also made in house. Outdoor seating and excellent services this place is excellent.

This was our first visit to Montreal and we'd eat at Le Cartet every day if we could. Between the five of us we ordered a total of four different dishes for breakfast and they were outstanding. Everyone loved everything they ordered. The waitress and service were absolutely outstanding. She was extremely helpful and very kind. We went back later the same day for cappuccino and lattes!

What a fabulous find! We were able to eat outside on their lovely patio. Our breakfast was delicious. I had avocado toast with roasted veggies. They were able to make it dairy free for my husband and I, which we really appreciated. He got a meat and egg dish. Both were yummy. The service was fast and the staff was very friendly. Bravo!
Wow one of the best I have had for brunch. Friendly and nice atmosphere. Good latte caramel sale, croissant and brunch menu. Must try. Not too long a wait if you come before 11am.

Great place for breakfast , lunch and brunch. Comfortable setting for family or business meeting. Food is fresh and delicious. The front of the restaurant has a deli case for quick food pickups. They have a nice outdoor seating area as well. Well worth a trip for a delicious meal. Service is excellent.

Le Cartet is a very cozy and great spot for breakfast/brunch/lunch on Rue McGill in Old Montreal. Le Cartet can be very busy on the weekend so get there early if you don't want to wait in line.We went on Sunday morning and we were seated right away. I had a large coffee moka that was served in a bowl. This was very good, a little weak for me, but still a nice coffee and mocha taste.I had the blueberry toast and as others have written, the portion sizes are pretty big. This again was delicious and came with fruits and apple butter.Le Cartet is very popular is seemed with the locals and tourists. That being so, it can get noisy. We were there in June and they had some tables outside also. I enjoyed Le Cartet and would go again when I return to Montreal.

This place is LEGIT for brunch.Me and 3 buddies were in town for the weekend and decided to try the food on a saturday morning. The wait was too long for inside and luckily seats were opening outside which was perfect as the weather reflected our luck. The staff were amazing, very friendly, and very helpful. But the food was the highlight here, it was insane! The portions were really big and perfect to fill our very hungry bellies. The food was really outstanding, all of our dishes were incredible, I wish this place existed for us back home.If i'm ever back in Montreal I will surely be here for sure.

We were visiting Old Montreal for the weekend and wanted to try some coffee. While walking around, we stumbled on this gem. I'm glad we went while we did because there was a huge line that would have taken a while. We decided to just get coffee to go (so we went to the left check out instead of the line on the right side). Coffee you can't go wrong. I got the cappuccino while my friend got the pumpkin spice latte. It was (in my opinion) pretty good, but my friend did not think her pumpkin spice latte was sweet enough.

This is an absolutely fantastic breakfast spot! Perfect for a brunch with the ladies, or even for a date. The food is beyond great, but the best part was the lattes. They were so well done! The staff are really great and the vibes of the place are amazing. Will be back with out s doubt! Absolutely awesome!

Easily my favorite breakfast place in all of Montreal. Recently went here with a group of eight and it's worth sharing a few pieces of information:1.) They don't take reservations for brunch on the weekends regardless of party size. This, surprisingly, was not a huge issue because we ended up only waiting for about fifteen minutes or so, despite the place being packed.2.) The service is quick. Even for a group that size we were in and out around forty five minutes for brunch.3.) The food is amazing. Six out of our eight went with the Brunch Canton which comes with ham, eggs, sausage, bacon, beans, potatoes a slice of toast, as well as a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. It is heavenly. As a bonus, the front of the restaurant is a little delicatessen where they sell a variety of prepared meals, foodstuffs, ***chocolate***, and drinks. Picked up some foie gras to bring home with me :) All in all, five stars!

Let me just start by saying I audibly gasped after the first several bites I took. Le Cartet is the BEST food I had in Montreal so far, and for a foodie city I feel like that's a pretty honorable title. It is truly incredible and plated beautifully, with portions that are sure to leave you full. The crepes and French toast were unique in the sense that they came topped with applesauce, raisins and pecans. All things I typically wouldn't eat but together they were heaven. The true favorite at the table was the poached eggs and salmon in toast with potatoes and salad with homemade vinegarette. I was almost about to order another one because my tastebuds were telling me yes but my stomach was telling me no. I'm looking forward to my next trip to Montreal just so I can eat here again.

Le Cartet is a great brunch spot in Old Montreal. While vacationing there with my family last month, we came for brunch on a Sunday morning. I had read that the wait could get pretty long, so we made sure to get there bright and early at 9:30. When we arrived, it was surprisingly almost full already! But luckily we were able to snag one of the few spots left at the long communal table.Two of us ordered the Brunch Toscan, and the other two ordered the Brunch de L'Atlantique. The brunch plates were all huge, and came with a glass of orange juice and coffee each. My Brunch Toscan included poached eggs on English muffins with Mornay sauce, duck fat potatoes, and fresh fruit (orange, grapefruit, and pineapple). The Brunch de L'Atlantique included a smoked salmon bagel, scrambled eggs, salad, sweet potato pancake, and fruit. Everything was delicious, though it seemed like the Brunch de L'Atlantique came with a lot more food!One side of the restaurant is a shop selling chocolates, jams, and other goods, so if you end up waiting for a while you at least have something to look at while you wait. Definitely arrive as early as possible to avoid long lines.

My go-to spot for brunch whenever I visit Montreal. Le Cartet is usually a reasonably short walk (10-15 mins) when I'm staying downtown. The one time I did have to drive here, parking was found easily on one of the side streets nearby. When you enter the restaurant there's a small shop where you can get various coffee grounds, teas, and sandwiches/salads. I always come rather early, around 8 or 9am (they are open at 7am), so I'm always seated very promptly. There are individual tables for parties of 2/4 and also long communal tables for larger groups. The menu is large with lots of sweet and savoury options. I always get the brunch des cantons that comes with bacon, sausage, ham (not the deli kind), beans, and roasted potatoes in duck fat in a cast iron skillet. The ham is my favourite part of the dish because it's very fatty and tender. If you don't eat much in the morning I wouldn't recommend this unless you are going to share it with someone else. During my last visit our entrees were preceded with some sort of milk/egg bread that whetted our appetites for the rich meal that was to come. The caffeinated drinks are all delectable. I always get the vanilla latte, coffee, or iced coffee when I'm there in the summer. My friend got a cappuccino last time and got the option of either bowl or cup. We left full, energized, and ready to take on the day!

Not a bad place to stop by for a quick bite to eat. They were moving from Breakfast to Lunch when we got there but no worries they seated us and then we began to wait....for a long time. I understand with the crowds and the mix of some people just talking and other tucking away into their meal. But when we aren't really doing much except waiting for our order to be taken there needs to be some sort of order of things. This is more of a friendly socializing place than a place where you get food. The food is alright but it isn't the best it has to offer. With that I'd say this is a sort of quick cafe that turned itself into a brunch place without much room to spare a lunch. In the midst of this chaos there is some room for improvement.

Le Cartet is one great place to try for breakfast with their interesting concept of boutique restaurant. Plus, they offer a wide range of products such bottled smoothies, sandwiches, salads, pastries and more. Laid-back crowd, cozy ambiance and delicious food. What can you ask for more? If the weather is great, you can even sit outside. This place definitely get off the beaten track.

I can't believe that that little gem had never been mentioned to me. What a pity that all this time I haven't been blessed with the delicious enlightenment that is le Cartet.To be honest- I've walked by this space several times and just assumed it was a specialty food shop that was ahem, well out of my price range. Don't be deceived like I was; as it turns out it's an amazing sit-down spot as well. My companion had the country-style breakfast, and while the whole thing looked awesome the most note-worthy thing about it is that the potatoes are cooked in duck fat (DUCK FAT POTATOES PEOPLE.) I ordered the "healthy" breakfast plate, complete with goat cheese toast and poached eggs; a yogurt parfait; as well as figs and cheese. yum.The space is exactly what you're hoping for- a cozy and accommodating yet classy spot where even when the place is packed you can hear your brunchin' buddies. I can't wait to bring everyone ever here.

This place would have been 4 stars if not for the pretentious snobby waitress that we had. This review will be broken down into two parts Service and Food.Service:When seated the waitress came up to us immediately and asked what drinks we wanted. Since we just got seated we had to look at the menu first. She rolled her eyes at us and when my husband asked what soda they served she snapped back with we have everything. Really? You have every soda imaginable stocked? She puts in our drink order at the bar and we can see the drinks are ready but to spite us it took her 20 mins to deliver our drinks. We would eye the drinks and she would look back at us, make eye contact, smirk and then reach for other table's drinks.Additionally, the store serves to go food at the front. My friend has a strict diet due to GI problems and the kitchen refuses any changes to their dishes. The only thing he could eat were some items from the to go section. After explaining the situation, the waitress said NO you cannot get a take out item and eat it at the table. My friend had to leave and get food someplace else.Then another table asked the same thing. The waitress said no but then changed her mind and let the person at that table get food from the takeout section and eat it with their family. Needless to say no tips came from our table.Food:I would say the eggs are the best thing for brunch on the menu. I had the eggs with goat cheese. Very silky and fluffy. The goat cheese added a good sharp flavor. Also ordered some butter croissants. The croissants were average. The ends were dry but the middle part was flakey with a nice buttery flavor. The rest of the table ordered a skillet with eggs, beans, ham, bacon and sausage. All agreed that the ham was very flavorful.Overall, food was good. However, a little expensive. Hope you don't ever get the same waitress that we got.

Le Cartet was a pleasant surprise. With a small market in the front, and a super relaxed atmosphere, it was the perfect brunch choice. I walked in with the intention of getting a late breakfast, but decided to go with lunch and get a pulled pork sandwich. It was a flavor bomb! With each bite, I got some of the perfectly toasted sesame bun, the savory pork with the sweet vinegar-style BBQ & a nice crunch from the cabbage slaw. The sandwich cake with nacho chips and a sour cream dip that was super yummy. Oh, my mimosa was also a great choice! I wasn't too thrilled about the butternut squash soup that came with my sandwich. The flavor profile wasn't there and I was a little disappointed. We also weren't offered the yummy bread that everyone talks about & looked for parking for more than half an hour. Otherwise, Le Cartet would have definitely gotten 5 stars.

Good brunch spot. We wanted something heavier than a pastry for breakfast so we came here. We both enjoyed our breakfasts and they poach a perfect egg. The only food item that was a bust was the sausage; it was very dry. I also ordered a cappuccino that never came at the end of my meal.

Many folks recommended this place to me - for brunch - when I first moved back to town. I don't get it. It specializes in "overs" - overrated and over-priced. I'm not necessarily saying that the food is bad - it's just mediocre. Since I used to live in the Old Port, I would still periodically go there. My favorite items were the omelettes (especially the goat cheese one). Coffees are fine (but I'm not expert/connoisseur in this) and fresh juices are tasty (absent the price consideration). Yeah, the goat cheese omelette is definitely the right way to go here (to the point of maybe being objective instead of subjective).

Come in early or there's going to be a long line for brunch. Great selections of products that lined the walls of the front of the restaurant. I got foie gras in a can and some pate. The pate I got was actually few dollars cheaper than the ones in duty free. There a selection of Italian products, from coffee to truffle oil. We got there around 10:30 on a sunday morning and there's a 20 minute wait, which is not bad. When we left there was a line going all the way outside on a cold windy day.The ambience is casual and has a modern cafe feel to it. Noise level is a bit loud, by wouldn't be bothered by it of you're in a group. I recommend small groups to this place. When we ordered the off the brunch menu we have complimentary bread pudding and freshly squeezed orange juice. Staff was really nice and served us pretty fast. Really great service, asked us of we want to split the check considering our group. Food was delicious. Most of us ordered the Maple Latte, really good and smooth. Overall great experience.

Went for brunch. As a vegetarian, I got the pesto toast with egg. It was quite yummy since I haven't really had toast with pesto before, but I secretly still prefer over avocado over pesto. But it was good! My boyfriend got the English breakfast ( whatever it's called) and he couldn't finish it! He said it was good but the portions are too big (which is not really much of a problem) I guess my four stars is because it's was decently yummy but not amazingly mind blowing. The downside is that it's a bid more expensive than other old port brunches ( I find).

We rented an airbnb about 3 stores down from this place and every time we stepped foot outside there was a line coming from Le Cartet that reached our door. My first thought? "Gotta yelp this place" and I did.So we queued up on line one sunny afternoon for brunch. The line moved slowly and a few times I almost made an about face, but thanks to this one overly enthusiastic guy behind me I toughed it out. He raved on and on about the food to some other strangers while he waited for his girlfriend. Some time passes, don't even know how long, and we finally get inside and get seated. As we're sitting down I see a waiter walk by with a carafe of OJ in one hand and a bottle of champagne in another. I told our waitress "I want that" (yes, kind of like a toddler at a candy store). $37 gets you a bottle of champagne with a free carafe of OJ. For two of us, we got about 5 glasses each. Pretty sweet deal.The food here is actually really pricey for brunch dishes, averaging at about $16 per dish. We thanked our lucky stars that the USD was strong so we balled out! I had the Brunch Des Cantons $17.99 (English breakfast style dish: beans, ham, bacon, eggs, sausage in a cast iron skillet) and my boo thang had the Toasta Mixta $11.29 (egg, ham, cheese, onions, and mustard sandwich). Both dishes were overall good but they could use some tweaks. The skillet dish was a little bland and the bread on the sandwich should've been toasted so it can hold better. It just kept falling apart.Service was great. Is this place worth the wait? I'm torn so I'll leave that up to you.

Wanted to go here as it was suggested by the Vagabrothers (youtubers) and the food just looked bomb diggity. Had to put in on my "must go eat" list. Went on a Monday morning for brunch with my hubs and there wasn't too bad a line. On weekends, there will definitely be a lot more people so go on a weekday if possible! Both the hubs + I got the brunch des cantons and coffee. Very delicious food + filling! You are first served an amuse bouche - not sure what it was but I think it was some sort of bread pudding but MANNN, if they sold that on its' own, it would be a best seller! Along with your food, you also get orange juice, free of charge too! Each brunch des cantons cost around $19 so to get the freebies makes the food worth it! Also stopped her the day of our departure back home and we picked up a croissant, fruits, and yogurt w/ granola. Delicious but pricy! Overall, come if you want to enjoy a hip spot along with great food!

Two words. ALMOND CROISSANT.It's huge [insert 'that's what she said' joke here] and has a good amount of almond filling. So I would try to split it with someone as a dessert (rather than try to devour the whole thing as breakfast like I did) because it can be a little too heavy for the morning hours.Le Cartet is a cute cafe with plenty of seating. They sell European snacks/gifts in the front (such as jam, candy, coffee, etc.) You can also get your coffee to go. And it ain't just 'coffee' anymore. So many different varieties to choose from!Service was quick (and they're nice enough to give you their wifi password if you're not from town). Do yourself a favor and go get that croissant, NOW!

Impressed. We found this place on Yelp and wanted to eat somewhere close to the old town. There were a few people waiting when we arrived (it was Sunday after all) but we barely waited 10 minutes. The coffee menu is quite large- allowing you to get a "bowl" of a cappuccino. We ordered the Brunch Nordique (pictured) the salmon bagel and their scrambled eggs with goat cheese. Everything was absolutely delicious. The combination of the pesto cream cheese and salmon was a wonderful surprise and the scrambled eggs were the best I've ever had. Service was perfect. I'd highly recommend coming here!
Excellent brunch spot featuring both healthy and traditional dishes. We really enjoyed our brunch here !

This is one of my favorite brunch spots in Montreal, been here many times.Food: very good. Highly recommend the brunch sante. The coffee is fantastic as well, can't go wrong with most of the brunch options. Portions are just the right size and come with orange juice.Service: fast and timely, staff is also very kind. Don't go too late or you'll wait a while in line, it starts getting very busy after 10.Price: reasonable, expect around 25/pp with coffee. Worth it for the quality of food.Ambiance: hipster vibes. There are both communal tables and non communal tables, and a very cute shop in front for taking things to go.

This place has such great ambience which makes it more the reason to brunch here when visiting Montreal. The menu has a plethora of dishes consisting of eggs, meats, and salads. They brew illy coffee and just ordering a regular cup with cream sugar does a number. They even let you Togo more coffee if you'd like! If you like fresh squeezed orange juice make sure you order one!
I really enjoy their food! Plus their services are very friendly! If you go there during summer, definitely choose to eat at patio!

Was looking for a French type of breakfast experience with the family during our Montreal stay. This was the place. Was impressed they even had a kids option because everywhere else we went did not. My daughters had a smoothie and the kids brunch with crepes. They loved it all. I had the smoked salmon poached eggs brunch. I think it was one of the best breakfasts I have ever had to the last bite. My husband and son also got brunch and were happy with their choices. Friendly service and great coffee. Would definitely come back of in the area again.

Great service! Came on a weekday at 10am and had great service and no line. It wasn't completely packed. They were nice about letting me practice my French too! Got the brunch des canton! It's all the meat cooked on a cast iron. Also got the mimosa. So good!

Came here twice for breakfast during my stay in Montreal. Fantastic restaurant. We came around 9 am on both occasions and were seated right away. Service was very friendly and accommodating.On the first visit we both ordered the Toscan breakfast, it was excellent!! It was very tasty and filling. I also ordered a hot chocolate and an orange juice. The hot chocolate was prob the best I've ever had, and even the OJ was super tasty. My friend had the hot chai latte and she also agreed it was delicious.On our second trip here we both weren't super hungry, and although we really wanted the Toscan breakfast again one more time before we departed for home, it was just gonna be too hearty of a meal. We ordered the avocado toast breakfast. It was very good. I ordered an iced chai latte this time and it was great! One of the best I've had.This place is definitely worth the visit. If I ever go to Montreal again, this will be one of the first restaurants I go to.

This was by far my favorite meal in Montréal. I ordered the brunch de Sucré and it had the best of everything. There was this french toast that was excellent along with crepes and french style yogurt with toppings. The atmosphere was lovely and after we finished eating, we bought some maple syrup and french mints from the store area

This place was off the hook for brunch! Great interior, cute and friendly waiters and a really fantastic ambiance. We were on vacation in beautiful Montreal, and this was comparable to any swank, popular place in my beloved Chicago.I had the Toasta Mixo - Portuguese grilled cheese - for brunch, and it was a LOT of food. A sort of egg sandwich accompanied by a nice fresh salad. It would have been enough for two to share, as it was a ton of food. Illy coffee, which is my FAVORITE. I'd return.

Brunch was delicious! Highly recommend getting the Cantons dish, it's so filling and flavour-able! Taking a star off because the service was a bit slow, however it was Saturday just before noon when we sat down to eat.

Great brunch spot, I had the Nordic and it was spot on! The poached egg was perfect, the salmon was fresh, and the best part was that there was a balance of flavors! The ambiance of the whole restaurant was also great. Certainly worth every nickel, because Canada no longer has pennies.(BTW this place is English friendly )
Typical franco canadian style. Great offering of healthy and fresh breakfast, and lors of togo options. Very friendly and organized staff

Had a great brunch here. Server was super friendly and attentive.Salmon bagel here was very good, comes with a mini salad, cream cheese was delectable. Best maple croissant I have ever had in my life. I dream about this croissant in my sleep.The little mini market up front is a very cool touch.
Food is great! Eating outside on the street was lovely. Benjamin gave us the best service we have gotten in Montreal!

I got the Brunch des Canton, it was a delicious sizzling hot plate with brunch galore. It was delicious but a bit too much salt.  The server guy was very friendly and attentive. They also have a store at the front with a great selection of treats.

This place is a gem! We had brunch here and it was fantastic. The service is fast, there are plenty of tables so the line went quickly. When we arrived, the line went right to the door but we were seated within 10 minutes. During our wait, we browsed the bakery and delicatessen areas as well as their incredible selection of chocolates. And we looked at the menu so we were ready to order. It was definitely worth the short wait. We can't wait to come to Montral again so we can return to our new favourite brunch place. Enjoy.

Pros: Beautiful setting, Delicious& Fresh food, Great serviceCons: Possible wait times, Food baby inducing, Busy-Ambiance- Very nice place to have weekend brunch, a lot of sunshine and open windows perfect to cure that night before hangover.  There is seating outside at the front and inside the restaurant as well as a quaint section selling treats at the front. Our server was phenomenal and was very enthusiastic throughout the whole service; explaining items and catering to all of our particular food needs.  Food ranges from 5-25$.-Food- Coupe Santé:  Yoghurt+ Granola+ Fruits. Ordered this to keep it light and I was very much satisfied. The fruits were fresh and varied,  the granola was in-house made  and still warm, and the yogurt was light and creamy. What more can you ask for. Trois Minutes: Two soft-boiled eggs with bio toast, duck fat potatoes, fresh fruit and jam.  Straightforward plate with quality ingredients. We also got the organic peanut butter, which was god-sent. -Overall- Go for weekend brunch don't be health conscious pansies like us and get the big brunch plates. Enjoy delicious&fresh food in a beautiful setting with good company.

I came here for breakfast/brunch on a Thursday. No line up or crowd which was nice. I ordered the smoked salmon scrambled eggs with black toast and a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice - which btw wasn't squeezed by the restaurant. The food was okay. I think it's a little overrated for what you get and for the price. I don't really get what the hype is all about. I've had better breakfast/brunch elsewhere. On a high note, the vanilla latte was spot on however it would have been nice if they did a little swirly graphic with the milk froth but they didn't. Service was meh.Overall, I probably wouldn't come back again any time soon. I think there are many other restaurants to try before I return again for my vanilla latte.

Went to this place for brunch while on a impromptu vacation to Montreal. This place was really awesome and after going to so many bad resturants on this trip, this place hit the spot. My girl got the scrambled eggs with chorizo, I had the blueberry French bread. We can't wait to go back!Main pointsService was really great. Even though it was 10 am and it was kind of busy, our waitress was spot on and really friendly. Food came out quick and the atmosphere was great.Food was spot on delicious, my French bread was just sweet enough, and I liked the fresh blueberries and cream. My girl really liked the salad that came with her eggs and the potatoes were great.

Yummy breakfast & cool place. Cappuccino with asparagus & Swiss cheese scrambled eggs on bread - how can you go wrong? Loved the fact that the fruit on my plate were berries and not the usual fruits served at chain breakfast places. Would go again.

Situated in Old Montréal, Le Cartet offers healthy yet gourmet European style breakfast at moderate pricing.For coffee, the restaurant uses Illy espresso, a great coffee with its roots in Italy, and my breakfast tea was from Paris, from the brand Kusmi Tea. What I found interesting and thoughtful was that the milk for my tea was frothed!The restaurant opens at 7am and serves their breakfast until 11am. We arrived at 7:30am, and by 8 o'clock, we were very surprised to see the restaurant fully packed with a line forming at the front waiting for tables! Our advice to you is to arrive before 8am and beat the morning rush. The restaurant offers a great vibe in their loft-like space, and is a great place to bond with your colleagues or friends. If you're looking for a quick coffee, the restaurant has an open coffee bar at the front which operates much like a café to get your caffeine fix. They also have a great selection of pre-packaged foods for a quick lunch midday, ranging from salads, yogurt bowls, pasta, and much more.I had Le Brunch Sucre. Because of its name, I expected most of my breakfast to be very sweet. To my surprise, most of the foods were sweet, but very balanced. For example, the raspberry jam on my crepe was more acidic than sweet. This is probably because they didn't add as much sugar than your generic jam company does, which provided a much refreshing taste when eaten together with the maple syrup.The yogurt and their granola also blew me away. The granola was tasted nothing different at the beginning, but as I kept eating it with the yogurt, I found myself tasting the ginger more gradually and realized that I didn't really need the honey to sweeten it. This means a lot, from someone that loves their things, especially yogurt, sweet! The yogurt was great; it seemed very fresh, thick, and dense in consistency. It balanced everything else in the bowl very well. I saw many women ordering the yogurt bowl as part of their breakfasts, and I agree, it's a great way to start your morning!The butter and maple syrup that the restaurant provided was quite different from the typical store-bought (or mass produced) goods as well. The butter tasted amazing, and was very light and fluffy in texture - not the hard and dense kind you see most of the time. The apple butter on the french toast was my favourite, and had to really hold myself back from buying a jar of it on my way out. It really was a perfect pairing with the french toast, and a great alternative to having your typical syrup and butter on it.Overall, I really recommend this breakfast to anyone that's looking for a sweet yet healthy option. The restaurant offers breakfast every weekday from 7am-11am, and also offers a weekend brunch both Saturday and Sunday from 9am to 3:30pm.

I enjoyed a nice brunch with some girlfriends here last weekend! We arrived right as the restaurant opened, so we did not have to worry about a line, but there was definitely one once we left.I had the Brunch de L'Atlantique, which is perfect for those who like smoked salmon. It included half of a Montreal bagel with smoked salmon and all of the fixings, smoked salmon and eggs, a smoked salmon cake, and salad greens. The bagel was delicious (as they always are in Montreal), and I quite liked the crispy flavorful salmon cake. I could have done without the eggs. It was certainly plenty of food for brunch.The prices seemed a bit high, but I think worth it for the quantity and quality of food. I recommend!

The salmon sandwich was a little too fishy, but the spicy chicken panini was excellent. Very cute,  minimalistic decor. Really enjoyed our overall experience. Staff is friendly and quick. Nice place for a quick lunch.

More like 3.5 stars. I was fortunate enough to arrive a bit late by VIA Rail to Montreal so I did not have to wait particularly long for my table for one. The seating is communal-esque so get ready to get comfortable with the people sitting around you. I had the Brunch de L'Atlantique which is a salmon lovers delight. It had a smoked salmon scramble, a salmon cream cheese bagel, a salmon cake and a salad. The food was very good as was the coffee and the portions were very on point. However, the brunch was very much on the spendy side. I don't mind paying a lot for food - but there was nothing terribly unique about what I had which is why I'm knocking this place down a tad. This is definitely a convenient and nice place to brunch, but with so many options around - I would be more open to trying different alternatives.

While in Montreal.. we came here for brunch on a Saturday. We arrived pretty early for brunch, about 930/10am and we waited online for 20 minutes or so.. the turn over is quite fast, and while you're waiting, there's so much to see in the store. You may also order a coffee or expresso while you're waiting! The food was divine.. I enjoyed it so much! I ordered the "Brunch Cartet" - I suggest you arrive hungry because the plate was massive! I would suggest this place to everyone who wants to experience a Montreal brunch and I would come back again.The staff are a delight and fun, it definitely made our stay more enjoyable!

My family and I went here for brunch based on the great reviews, and we weren't disappointed!I got Le Sante as people seemed to be suggesting, and was quite pleased. The poached eggs were perfection. The mixed greens they lay atop were fresh and a nice addition to the meal. I asked for my pesto cheese on the side and didn't try it, so I can't speak for that, but I can only assume that it would have been phenomenal. The greek yogurt was topped generously with a sweet granola with fresh blueberries, served with honey on the side - it was the perfect mix of both tart and sweet! My other half got Le Nordique, which he thoroughly enjoyed...he was even kind enough to share some of it with me!The parents both got the salmon bagel plate; they substituted a baguette for the bagel and loved every crunchy bite.
